{{also|辭書|辞书}}
==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|じ|しょ}}
A repurposing of older term {{m|ja|辞書|tr=jisho||letter of resignation|pos=see below}}, based on a reanalysis of the constituent characters {{m|ja|辞|tr=ji||resignation, quitting; word}} + {{m|ja|書|tr=sho||writing, record, document, book}}. Influenced by {{etyl|ltc|-}}-derived term {{m|ja|辞典|tr=jiten||dictionary}}, wherein the {{m|ja|辞}} character expresses the meaning {{m|en|word}} from {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=じしょ}} {{m|zh|辭|tr=zi}}, instead of the meaning {{m|en|resignation}} or {{m|en|quitting}} from {{etyl|ltc|-}} {{m|zh|辤|tr=zi}}. Note that both of these older character forms were later conflated in both {{etyl|ja|-}} and {{etyl|zh|-}} into the simplified version [[辞]], with the {{m|en|word}} meaning becoming dominant in {{etyl|zh|-}}.

First appearance in Japanese with the {{m|en|dictionary}} sense might be the 1595 publication by the Jesuits of the {{lang|ja|羅葡日辞書}} (''Ra-Ho-Nichi Jisho'', “Latin-Portuguese-Japanese Dictionary”), alternate title ''{{lang|la|Dictionarium Latino Lusitanicum, ac Iaponicum}}''.<ref name="Nipponica">'''1984''', {{lang|ja|[[w:日本大百科全書|日本大百科全書：ニッポニカ]]}} (''Nippon Dai Hyakka Zensho: Nipponica'', “[[w:Encyclopedia Nipponica|Encyclopedia Nipponica]]”) (in Japanese), [[w:Tokyo|Tōkyō]]: [[w:Shogakukan|Shogakukan]], relevant text online [https://kotobank.jp/word/%E8%BE%9E%E5%85%B8-74325#西欧系日本語辞典 here]. Note the [[typo]] in the Latin name as listed in this source, showing ''Dictionaricum'' instead of the correct {{m|la|dictionarium|Dictionarium}}.</ref>

Compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} {{m|zh|辭書|tr=císhū||dictionary, lexicon}}, possibly reborrowed from or otherwise influenced by the Japanese.

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|じ|しょ}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=じしょ}} compound {{m|zh|辤書|tr=zi syo|lit=quit + writing}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|y=go|じしょ|acc=1|acc_ref=NHK,DJR,SMK5}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|じしょ|kyu=辤書}}

# a [[letter]] of [[resignation]]
# a formal document of [[abdication]] when one [[emperor]] [[step down|steps down]] and a new emperor [[ascend]]s the [[throne]]

=====Synonyms=====
{{der-top|Synonyms}}
* {{sense|resignation}} {{ja-r|辞表|じひょう}}
* {{sense|abdication}} {{ja-r|御報書|ごほうしょ}}
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|じ|そ|sort=しそ'}}
The {{m|ja|直音表記|tr=chokuon hyōki|lit=straight-sound spelling}} of ''jisho'' above. Most common from the [[w:Heian period|Heian]] through the [[w:Muromachi period|Muromachi]] periods.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

It is unclear if the pronunciation itself also shifted, or just the spelling.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|y=i|じそ}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|じそ|kyu=辤書}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=しそ'|obsolete}} a [[letter]] of [[resignation]]
